summary: It’s true what they say about the world ENDING -It goes not with a B A N G but with a whisper.   We’ve all lost something,...
caption:
It’s true what they say about the world ENDING -It goes not with a B A N G but with a whisper.

 We’ve all lost something, someone, some part of ourselves that feels impossible to get back.  How can the earth keep turning without the missing?And somewhere, deep within the recesses of the Soul Stone, lies a secret world, a pocket dimension where those who turned to ash in the Snap went.  Two parallel worlds hang in the balance as those trapped inside yearn to break free, and those on the outside search in desperation to break in.  Are you strong enough to join in the fight for not just one dimension, but two? Do you have what it takes to escape an infinity stone?

* SoulStoneHQ is a literate and welcoming post Infinity War roleplay group devoted to world-building and character development. In this group we have two categories, deceased and alive. The deceased characters can interact only with other deceased characters from where they’re trapped inside the Soul Stone’s pocket dimension. The live characters can interact only with live characters from where they have set up shop in the real world. The characters trapped in the Soul World will eventually find their way free of its clutches, but not without hardship and struggle. Do you have what it takes to escape an Infinity Stone?

Main◆Plot◆Characters◆Rules◆Questions

blog.description: I'm the Sorcerer Supreme, only one in the world. When the Avengers are out of their depth, which is always, they consult me.

summary: What more could I lose (Spoilers for Infinity War)
title: What more could I lose (Spoilers for Infinity War)
body:
If the theory suggesting that every character killed by the snap is trapped inside the soul stone like Gamora, and therefor that every character killed before (ie Loki and Heimdall) will stay dead is true, does it mean that all the Avengers will reunite with their friends and family except Thor? That is just too sad.

Now I can’t get this image of Thor alone during the reunion scene out of my head: Bucky looking at Steve with a big smile and making a snarky comment like “I swear I don’t do it on purpose”, Peter afraid of Tony’s reaction whispering “I’m sorry” and Tony overwhelmed with emotion left uncharacteristically speechless, Rocket, running into Groot’s arms: “You have grown!” “I missed you guys, even you Quill”, Starlord: “Where is Gamora?” turns around and sees her smiling, Shuri giving T’Challa his Black Panther necklace back “This belongs to you, brother” before falling into his arms in tears of joy, and Okoye falsely angry “If you die one more time, I swear I will kill you myself”…

And Thor just sitting alone with a bittersweet smile every time a friend pats him on the back while Valkyrie silently puts her hand on his shoulder. Then he finally turns to Strange:

- They’re not coming back, are they?

body:
Thor should’ve mistaken Rocket for a squirrel (re: Ratatoskr) but maybe the line didn’t “test well”?

And he’s with a Tree too, damn, what a missed opportunity.

body:
Night shift though

We work night shift, 12 hours no sleep while all our lovely old people get rest through the night.

We’re always fucking tired.


So we’re chilling in the sitting area and I’m like half asleep barely coherent when my co-worker grabs my arm and with the straightest face goes, “You deserve ALL the Chris Evans’s of the world,”

😂😂😂😊

blog.name: vindicatedtruth
blog.title: amaranthine
blog.description:
To live in this world
you must be able
to do three things:
to love what is mortal;
to hold it
against your bones knowing
your own life depends on it;
and, when the time comes to let it
go,
to let it go.
- Mary Oliver

summary: SPOILERS FOR AVENGERS 4 AHEAD (though it’s all mostly rumours and speculation—nothing’s been confirmed) There’s been a circling...
body:
SPOILERS FOR AVENGERS 4 AHEAD

(though it’s all mostly rumours and speculation—nothing’s been confirmed)

There’s been a circling (supposedly) leaked plot of the fourth Avengers movie in which only 2 out of the 6 original Avengers are going to come out alive; which means it’s possible that those who died at the end of Infinity War will be saved retroactively by time travel (or so the supposed leaked plot says) through the quantum realm—hence the major role of Ant-Man in the 4th Avengers movie.

It’s undeniable that it’s going to be heartbreaking for a lot of fans, especially those whose favourites are Tony, Steve, Thor, Bruce, Natasha, and Clint, who are the OG Avengers after all.  I’ve been seeing fans online declaring that if any of the OG Avengers die, they (the fans) will be done with the MCU, which… is fair, given that there’s grief to process in losing a beloved character.

I admit that I’ll also be terribly heartbroken to lose any of them too, but… a part of me is also looking forward to how this major change will revive the MCU.

As a woman of color, I’m looking forward to see more diverse heroes take the helm now from an overwhelming number of straight white male heroes (Natasha’s the only female OG Avenger, and even then she’s still white).  I’ve said this before, but when the Phase One Movies first came out (culminating with the first Avengers movie), they… didn’t quite hold my attention because I couldn’t relate as much to the straight white male heroes, given that I have none of those characteristics.

I lost interest in the MCU after awhile, until I gave Black Panther a chance.  

I was blown away.  More women and people of color than the entire MCU combined so far.  And more than that, these characters all had agency, with their own motivations and choices and they weren’t just there to act as a foil to the white male hero, unlike most of the earlier MCU movies.

Finally, after too long—after a decade—Marvel’s finally realising that their audience isn’t just composed of straight white men.  Its audience is diverse.  Therefore, its heroes have to be diverse as well.

Black Panther had been a trailblazer in this—and an incredibly lucrative one at that.  No matter what happens after Avengers 4, it’s undeniable that Wakanda and its people are going to be around for a long time, and that’s exciting.  Especially because finally, finally, Marvel’s also handing women the reins.  Heck, it took DC allowing Wonder Woman to star in her own blockbuster movie that Marvel finally realised, hey, maybe they’re on to something here.

Next year will be our first look at Captain Marvel, a solo Black Widow movie is also in the works, and Kevin Feige had already mentioned that they’re also planning to work on Ms. Marvel sometime soon, which is exciting because of those three solo female-centered movies, only one of them features a woman of color.

It’s both exciting but also saddening that leaps of diversity like this is still something to celebrate about, rather than something that should have long been accepted as normal.  It’s frustrating that the MCU took this long to realise that people aren’t made up of just straight white men.

They’re trying, but sometimes it’s a hit and miss. Doctor Strange appropriated Asian culture, giving the lead to a white actor when they could have just easily corrected the narrative by giving it to an Asian (preferably Nepalese) actor; instead, in addition to that, they even hired a white actress to take a canonically Tibetan role in the comics (which means they had no excuse in that aspect anymore).  Spiderman at least took the effort to normalise the presence of people of color in high school, but then the lead is still a straight white male, albeit younger, and it flatout ignored realistic racial and historical dynamics by making the white lead the target of bullying by a person of color, when in reality it should be the other way around. (Case in point: all of the school shootings in America were done by white men.)  Most of all, the MCU straightwashed most of its canonically queer characters in the comics, including Loki, Ayo, and Valkyrie.

It’s both frustrating and saddening that despite it being 2018 already, despite it being the 21st Century, despite the MCU being around for ten years already, it’s still too afraid to challenge the status quo that only the straight white males are the ones who are the forefront of anything and everything.  I’m glad and relieved that at least the MCU is at least taking baby steps to dismantling that bigoted worldview, but at the same time, it has to be two-way.

The audience has to dismantle its bigoted worldview too.

I understand the heartbreak in losing the OG Avengers.  They’ve become an irreplaceable part of my heart too.  But perhaps there’s an important political symbolism in their handing over the reins to not only the new generation of Avengers, but to women and people of color.  As if it’s also saying, it’s about time we realise that it’s not only white men who are relevant.  It’s not only white men who have the power to change the world—and that maybe, just maybe, it’s these straight, white, rich, privileged men who have actually brought the world to ruins, and it’s up to these new Avengers to show what real heroism is like: standing up for the marginalised and the oppressed, because they were, too.

Because real heroes don’t come from privilege. Real heroes rise from those who have known what suffering is, and fight to ensure no one else will have to suffer the way they do, precisely because they know what it’s like.

It’s up to us, the audience, to echo that.  I understand wanting to quit the MCU after the heartbreak of losing beloved characters.  But there’s more at stake here, because if we suddenly stop believing in heroes after the white male ones die… then that’s also tantamount to saying that no other heroes other than the white males are relevant.  That women, people of color, queer people… they’re not and can’t be heroes after all.

We have to believe in people like them, if we want them to be the heroes they can be in representing us, the people who have long been wondering why we don’t see people who look like us be as awesome as Iron Man or Captain America or Thor or the Hulk.  Wakanda will finally represent the struggle of black people all over the world.  Black Widow and Captain Marvel will take the helm in women empowerment.  And Ms. Marvel will finally shine the spotlight on a young girl of color, who is also Muslim, and Pakistani, and hopefully dismantle all bigoted beliefs about both her religion and her race.  And who knows, probably someday, Valkyrie and Ayo (and if he comes back, Loki) will finally be proudly and openly gay and be a symbol of empowerment to the LGBT community.

We have to support that.  We have to show the powers that be behind Disney and Marvel that diversity sells, because representation matters.  Don’t let the death of any of the OG Avengers let you stop believing in heroes.

Let it be the beginning of what real heroism looks like: by fighting the status quo.

It’s both frustrating and saddening that despite it being 2018 already, despite it being the 21st Century, despite the MCU being around for ten years already, it’s still too afraid to challenge the status quo that only the straight white males are the ones who are the forefront of anything and everything.  I’m glad and relieved that at least the MCU is at least taking baby steps to dismantling that bigoted worldview, but at the same time, it has to be two-way.

The audience has to dismantle its bigoted worldview too.

I understand the heartbreak in losing the OG Avengers.  They’ve become an irreplaceable part of my heart too.  But perhaps there’s an important political symbolism in their handing over the reins to not only the new generation of Avengers, but to women and people of color.  As if it’s also saying, it’s about time we realise that it’s not only white men who are relevant.  It’s not only white men who have the power to change the world—and that maybe, just maybe, it’s these straight, white, rich, privileged men who have actually brought the world to ruins, and it’s up to these new Avengers to show what real heroism is like: standing up for the marginalised and the oppressed, because they were, too.

Because real heroes don’t come from privilege. Real heroes rise from those who have known what suffering is, and fight to ensure no one else will have to suffer the way they do, precisely because they know what it’s like.

It’s up to us, the audience, to echo that.  I understand wanting to quit the MCU after the heartbreak of losing beloved characters.  But there’s more at stake here, because if we suddenly stop believing in heroes after the white male ones die… then that’s also tantamount to saying that no other heroes other than the white males are relevant.  That women, people of color, queer people… they’re not and can’t be heroes after all.

We have to believe in people like them, if we want them to be the heroes they can be in representing us, the people who have long been wondering why we don’t see people who look like us be as awesome as Iron Man or Captain America or Thor or the Hulk.  Wakanda will finally represent the struggle of black people all over the world.  Black Widow and Captain Marvel will take the helm in women empowerment.  And Ms. Marvel will finally shine the spotlight on a young girl of color, who is also Muslim, and Pakistani, and hopefully dismantle all bigoted beliefs about both her religion and her race.  And who knows, probably someday, Valkyrie and Ayo (and if he comes back, Loki) will finally be proudly and openly gay and be a symbol of empowerment to the LGBT community.

We have to support that.  We have to show the powers that be behind Disney and Marvel that diversity sells, because representation matters.  Don’t let the death of any of the OG Avengers let you stop believing in heroes.

Let it be the beginning of what real heroism looks like: by fighting the status quo.
trail.content:
SPOILERS FOR AVENGERS 4 AHEAD

(though it’s all mostly rumours and speculation—nothing’s been confirmed)

There’s been a circling (supposedly) leaked plot of the fourth Avengers movie in which only 2 out of the 6 original Avengers are going to come out alive; which means it’s possible that those who died at the end of Infinity War will be saved retroactively by time travel (or so the supposed leaked plot says) through the quantum realm—hence the major role of Ant-Man in the 4th Avengers movie.

It’s undeniable that it’s going to be heartbreaking for a lot of fans, especially those whose favourites are Tony, Steve, Thor, Bruce, Natasha, and Clint, who are the OG Avengers after all.  I’ve been seeing fans online declaring that if any of the OG Avengers die, they (the fans) will be done with the MCU, which… is fair, given that there’s grief to process in losing a beloved character.

I admit that I’ll also be terribly heartbroken to lose any of them too, but… a part of me is also looking forward to how this major change will revive the MCU.

As a woman of color, I’m looking forward to see more diverse heroes take the helm now from an overwhelming number of straight white male heroes (Natasha’s the only female OG Avenger, and even then she’s still white).  I’ve said this before, but when the Phase One Movies first came out (culminating with the first Avengers movie), they… didn’t quite hold my attention because I couldn’t relate as much to the straight white male heroes, given that I have none of those characteristics.

I lost interest in the MCU after awhile, until I gave Black Panther a chance.  

I was blown away.  More women and people of color than the entire MCU combined so far.  And more than that, these characters all had agency, with their own motivations and choices and they weren’t just there to act as a foil to the white male hero, unlike most of the earlier MCU movies.

Finally, after too long—after a decade—Marvel’s finally realising that their audience isn’t just composed of straight white men.  Its audience is diverse.  Therefore, its heroes have to be diverse as well.

Black Panther had been a trailblazer in this—and an incredibly lucrative one at that.  No matter what happens after Avengers 4, it’s undeniable that Wakanda and its people are going to be around for a long time, and that’s exciting.  Especially because finally, finally, Marvel’s also handing women the reins.  Heck, it took DC allowing Wonder Woman to star in her own blockbuster movie that Marvel finally realised, hey, maybe they’re on to something here.

Next year will be our first look at Captain Marvel, a solo Black Widow movie is also in the works, and Kevin Feige had already mentioned that they’re also planning to work on Ms. Marvel sometime soon, which is exciting because of those three solo female-centered movies, only one of them features a woman of color.

It’s both exciting but also saddening that leaps of diversity like this is still something to celebrate about, rather than something that should have long been accepted as normal.  It’s frustrating that the MCU took this long to realise that people aren’t made up of just straight white men.

They’re trying, but sometimes it’s a hit and miss. It’s both frustrating and saddening that despite it being 2018 already, despite it being the 21st Century, despite the MCU being around for ten years already, it’s still too afraid to challenge the status quo that only the straight white males are the ones who are the forefront of anything and everything.  I’m glad and relieved that at least the MCU is at least taking baby steps to dismantling that bigoted worldview, but at the same time, it has to be two-way.

summary: Me before Infinity War: wow, this is it, Tony Stark's gonna die. Either Infinity War or Avengers 4 is gonna be the end of Tony...
body:
Me before Infinity War: wow, this is it, Tony Stark’s gonna die. Either Infinity War or Avengers 4 is gonna be the end of Tony Stark. It’s sad, but I guess I’m ready for it, it’s time.

Me during IW when Tony Stark gets stabbed: oh no! This is it! I don’t want this!

Me after IW: Tony Stark must never die. He can’t die. It can’t ever happen now. I won’t allow it. Tony will ride off into the sunset with Pepper, he’ll retire and live happily ever after raising his baby and mentoring Peter while the new generation of Avengers take the lead. Tony Stark will live forever.

summary: When Playing with Fire, You’re Bound to Get Burned (Loki X Reader)
title: When Playing with Fire, You’re Bound to Get Burned (Loki X Reader)
body:
Summary: You and Loki have begun to grow close over the last week or so, Thor and Steven are still gone and it’s been you and him in the tight quarters of the main library, reading together on the couches with palpable tension and desire between the two of you that both of you are oblivious to. But what will happen when the two of you decide to play a little game?

Author’s Note: I’ve fallen in love with this series, I just can’t help myself from updating, even when it’s this late at night. Inspiration strikes at the most inopportune times, but I wouldn’t have it any other way, I hope you guys love it cause I LOVE writing this :) stay tuned for the next few parts and as always: ENJOY! (I’M SORRY IT’S SO SHORT!) (AND IT’S SO LATE SO I’M TIRED)

Tags: @orighami @lokislittlefangirl @amor67figment-love @fire-in-her-veinz

Warning: Naughty Loki ;), flirting FLIRTING FLIRTING, so many sexual references, I’m not even sorry, a little angst cause I savor drama, and major fluffity fluff

You’ve laid down across Loki’s lap, your head resting on his long legs, the Great Gatsby tucked between your fingers, clutching it to your chest when you get to your favorite part of the novel. Loki watches you with a softness in his alluring green and blue eyes, you can never make up your mind of which color they are, so you’ve decided to say both, never knowing which one fits him best.

“What are you thinking about, love?” he leans back against the couch cushion, lifting his eyes from his book to chance a glance at you and your beautiful smile.

“Mm,” you hum happily, looking at him from where you lay with a big, bright grin. “I love this quote from the book.”

“You sound so passionate when you talk about literature, darling, your face is lighting up,” he notices with a warm expression. “Do you write?”

“When I was younger I would,” you reminisce, sighing contently, smiling at the far off memories playing through your mind. “I had this little spot… in my backyard, under my favorite tree, a willow tree, and I would sit there…” you pause to laugh lightly. “And just bring out my journal, scribbling outlandish fairy tales about mythical creatures and true love. I barely even knew what love was at that age… too bad all of it was destroyed in the fire, I bet reading it would have been hilarious,” you laugh, but it comes out sadder than you intended.

His embrace on you tightens when he sees your frown, “Don’t discount yourself, love,” he says, an amused tone in his words despite his reassurance. “Who knows, young (y/n) could have been the next Hemingway…”

“Oh, God no, comparing me to him is an insult to his craft, I’m nowhere near as talented,” you shake your head with a smile. “Besides, I haven’t written in so long.”

He shakes his head, wondering how someone as astonishing as you could think so little of yourself, “Writing, my dear, is like riding a bike, once you learn, you never forget how to do it, and with practice, you get better and better,” he explains, setting his book down next to him on the small table beside you two.

“Read the quote to me, kitten,” he whispers, shifting you so that he’s laying down and your laying with the back of your head against his hard, surprisingly muscular chest. His hands found your hair, playing with it lazily, desperately needing to touch you in anyway he can, even if it’s not the way he truly wants.

You raise your eyebrows, “Are you sure?” you ask him, turning to look him in the eye, not finding any doubts or hesitance in them. Or he’s just very good at hiding it. “I don’t want to bore you.”

“(Y/N)…” he whispers, rolling his eyes with a graciously soft smile, catching you off guard. “The next time you say something about yourself that is other than only good things, I will knock you off this couch.”

“You wouldn’t,” you scoff. 

“Don’t you know who you’re talking to, love? I am the god of tricks, I can do far worse if so is requested or deserved,” he says with a slight raise of his brow, a wicked glint in his eyes. 

“Requested?” you can’t help but grin at the insinuation. “Perhaps I should begin reading before I take you up on that offer.”

Loki shifts beneath you, clenching his jaw, holding himself tightly as unholy thoughts fill his mind again, all of which you star in. He couldn’t possibly imagine you ever sharing his affections for you, he only thinks your harmless flirting is just apart of your friendly banter, not that you care for him as well. In his mind, he’s still the monster people think of him as, not how you really see him. After getting to know him, you now see him as kind, warm, gentle, if not mischievous and an expert at manipulation and smirking, always winking slyly from across the room at you. 

You might just say you are slowly falling for him. 

He laughs nervously, “Just read, darling.”

“Alright, fine,” you roll your eyes, opening the book back up to the spot you’re looking for, skimming your finger over the printed words. You smile once you find it, “’There I was, way off my ambitions, getting deeper in love every minute, and all of a sudden I didn’t care,’” you whisper, your sweet, velvet like voice nearly lulling Loki to sleep. 

Loki wraps his arms around you, shaking his head, “How tragic.”

“Tragic?” you ask. “It’s beautiful, not tragic. Shakespeare is tragic. When I read this, all I hear is new beginnings and accepting love from not only others but alsop herself.”

“What I hear is someone falling in love with someone who’s party obsessed, arrogant, foolish, and only ends up being murdered in the end, it’s tragic. She’s fallen for the wrong person, down the wrong path, and it only ends in heartbreak and disaster.”

You spin yourself around, laying face up on him now, resting your chin against his chest, “You’re only seeing half the picture here, not what the author wants you to see, now that you have to look for. Gatsby only throws these parties in an attempt to get Daisy’s attention and have her attend them, he’s parading all the wrong things, but that’s only because he’s human and he’s used to the people in his lives only be attracted to his wealth, not him. She’s the first that defies that,” you lay out for him, hand gestures and all. “I think it’s beautiful.”

Loki smiles, tongue in cheek, an action that cause heat to pool into the pit of your stomach and a blush in your cheeks, “I’ve always prided myself in being insightful and intelligent, but it seems I’ve been beaten for the title.”

“You’ve met your match, Loki Lafeuyson,” you return his kind smile, tucking your hands beneath your chin, fluttering your lashes teasingly. 

“Indeed I have,” he agrees, realizing now just how far he’s fallen.

“So what do we do now?” you ask him, his fingers tracing light circles into your thin, t-shirt clad back. 

He runs his hand closer to where the clasp of your bra lays, idly fiddling with the lace of your brassiere, meeting your eyes for only a moment. A smirk filled with enough sin to lead anyone astray graces his delightfully pink lips, your breath catching at the sight of it.

He takes notice of this and his smirk only widens, a hand sliding down to grip your waist, eliciting a small whimper from you, “Mm, kitten, the noises you make when I touch you are absolutely sinful…”

“Loki…” you warn him, afraid of what you’ll start if he continues, lips curling when his hand slips beneath your shirt, his cool hands contrasting against your red hot skin.

“Darling…” he purrs and just his voice alone is enough to almost send you over the edge, to the point of no return. He meets your eyes for a moment, as if asking for permission for this little game the two of you are about to play, you nod before thinking better of it, heat creeping up the back of your neck at his impish smile. 

He reaches your back and expertly, yet agonizingly slow, unclasps the hook and slips your bra out from underneath your shirt, tossing it onto the floor.

“That was impressive,” you say and it’s your turn to smile with your tongue in your cheek, feeling suddenly exposed in front of him even with a shirt on. But the two of you constantly undress each other with your eyes.

“Oh, love, you haven’t seen nothing yet,” he whispers in the quiet room, flipping the two of you over so he’s on top of you, one hand holding himself above you, positioned in between your legs.

“You’re playing a dangerous game, Loki,” you whisper coolly, chest heaving with each inhale and exhale of breath. 

“The only way I know how,” he winks, scanning your body with darkened eyes, licking his bottom lip, watching you squirm beneath him. “What are you doing to me, kitten?”

“I’m only returning the favor,” you smile, rolling your hips against his, satisfied when you see the way he grits his teeth and closes his eyes from just your touch.

“Naughty, naughty girl,” he purrs, shaking his head with a low chuckle.

“I’ve learned from the best,” you respond smugly.

“You certainly have,” he muses, flashing another criminal smile.

“Don’t start something you can’t finish, Loki,” you tell him, one hand reaching up to cup the side of his face.

He leans into your touch, kissing the inside of your palm sweetly, “I’m not the one that did, darling.”

“You’re saying I did?” you laugh. “By slapping you?”

“I’m not ashamed to admit I was hooked from the beginning, my pet,” he smiles, dipping down to place tender kisses against the soft skin of your neck, making you gasp at the sensation of his cold lips on your body. “I’m enchanted by you, in all ways possible.”

“It seems the spell I cast on you has worked, it was my plan all along,” you tease him with a small laugh, inhaling sharply once more when he begins to nip and suck and bite on the hollow of your collarbone. That would surely leave a mark in the coming days. You know that’s what he wants, to mark you as his, his territory. The thought excited you. Being his. You can’t believe how good he is at this, so easily making you beg for more and grovel at his feet. 

“I really hope your joking, darling,” he teases back. “But I wouldn’t be at all surprised if you weren’t.”

You breathe out a laugh. “I guess you’ll never know then,” you raise an eyebrow when he breaks away to look at you. His striking eyes wash over you, paired with another gorgeous smirk. Those eyes fall on your lips, and he darts his tongue out to wet his own.

“Are you going to kiss me, Loki?” you ask softly, taking his face in your hands again, drawing small circles with your thumb on his cheek. 

“I want to, believe me. Desperately,” he says, breath catching when you meet his eyes, he fumbles for the right words. “But… are you sure?” he breaks his gaze away from your slightly parted lips, willing himself to look elsewhere. “Because-”

“Loki…” you coo softly, playing with the tips of his marvelous, raven hair, looking him in the eye, both of you breathing harshly, so close your noses bump into each other and lips brush, heart beating loud in your own chest. Not even kissing, yet electricity shoots through both of you, your eyes fluttering closed from the pleasure. “I’ve never been more sure of anything in my life. Because I-”

“Oh, my…” a smug, familiar voice says in the doorway, catching both of your attentions, heads snapping in their direction. 

Tony. Fucking. Stark. And the rest of the Avengers. All in your home and all at once. Watching and ruining a moment between you and Loki. 

“Reindeer games, and our sweet, sweet (y/n),” Tony says, looking to Natasha who’s smirking like an idiot. Steve’s eyes widen he sees the discarded bra on the floor, which makes you blush every shade of scarlet. Tony shakes his head like a disappointed father would when scolding his child. “I never thought I’d see the day…”

They’re all looking at the two of you, neither of you moving, too frozen from shock at the sight of them all. Bucky looks between the two of you and shakes his head, “I think this is the part when one of you starts explaining what the hell is going on.”

He couldn’t possibly imagine you ever sharing his affections for you, he only thinks your harmless flirting is just apart of your friendly banter, not that you care for him as well. In his mind, he’s still the monster people think of him as, not how you really see him. After getting to know him, you now see him as kind, warm, gentle, if not mischievous and an expert at manipulation and smirking, always winking slyly from across the room at you. 

You might just say you are slowly falling for him. 

He laughs nervously, “Just read, darling.”

“Alright, fine,” you roll your eyes, opening the book back up to the spot you’re looking for, skimming your finger over the printed words. You smile once you find it, “’There I was, way off my ambitions, getting deeper in love every minute, and all of a sudden I didn’t care,’” you whisper, your sweet, velvet like voice nearly lulling Loki to sleep. 

Loki wraps his arms around you, shaking his head, “How tragic.”

“Tragic?” you ask. “It’s beautiful, not tragic. Shakespeare is tragic. When I read this, all I hear is new beginnings and accepting love from not only others but alsop herself.”

“What I hear is someone falling in love with someone who’s party obsessed, arrogant, foolish, and only ends up being murdered in the end, it’s tragic. She’s fallen for the wrong person, down the wrong path, and it only ends in heartbreak and disaster.”

You spin yourself around, laying face up on him now, resting your chin against his chest, “You’re only seeing half the picture here, not what the author wants you to see, now that you have to look for. Gatsby only throws these parties in an attempt to get Daisy’s attention and have her attend them, he’s parading all the wrong things, but that’s only because he’s human and he’s used to the people in his lives only be attracted to his wealth, not him. She’s the first that defies that,” you lay out for him, hand gestures and all. “I think it’s beautiful.”

Loki smiles, tongue in cheek, an action that cause heat to pool into the pit of your stomach and a blush in your cheeks, “I’ve always prided myself in being insightful and intelligent, but it seems I’ve been beaten for the title.”

“You’ve met your match, Loki Lafeuyson,” you return his kind smile, tucking your hands beneath your chin, fluttering your lashes teasingly. 

“Indeed I have,” he agrees, realizing now just how far he’s fallen.

“So what do we do now?” you ask him, his fingers tracing light circles into your thin, t-shirt clad back. 

He runs his hand closer to where the clasp of your bra lays, idly fiddling with the lace of your brassiere, meeting your eyes for only a moment. A smirk filled with enough sin to lead anyone astray graces his delightfully pink lips, your breath catching at the sight of it.

He takes notice of this and his smirk only widens, a hand sliding down to grip your waist, eliciting a small whimper from you, “Mm, kitten, the noises you make when I touch you are absolutely sinful…”

“Loki…” you warn him, afraid of what you’ll start if he continues, lips curling when his hand slips beneath your shirt, his cool hands contrasting against your red hot skin.

“Darling…” he purrs and just his voice alone is enough to almost send you over the edge, to the point of no return. He meets your eyes for a moment, as if asking for permission for this little game the two of you are about to play, you nod before thinking better of it, heat creeping up the back of your neck at his impish smile. 

He reaches your back and expertly, yet agonizingly slow, unclasps the hook and slips your bra out from underneath your shirt, tossing it onto the floor.

“That was impressive,” you say and it’s your turn to smile with your tongue in your cheek, feeling suddenly exposed in front of him even with a shirt on. But the two of you constantly undress each other with your eyes.

“Oh, love, you haven’t seen nothing yet,” he whispers in the quiet room, flipping the two of you over so he’s on top of you, one hand holding himself above you, positioned in between your legs.

“You’re playing a dangerous game, Loki,” you whisper coolly, chest heaving with each inhale and exhale of breath. 

“The only way I know how,” he winks, scanning your body with darkened eyes, licking his bottom lip, watching you squirm beneath him. “What are you doing to me, kitten?”

“I’m only returning the favor,” you smile, rolling your hips against his, satisfied when you see the way he grits his teeth and closes his eyes from just your touch.

“Naughty, naughty girl,” he purrs, shaking his head with a low chuckle.

“I’ve learned from the best,” you respond smugly.

“You certainly have,” he muses, flashing another criminal smile.

“Don’t start something you can’t finish, Loki,” you tell him, one hand reaching up to cup the side of his face.

He leans into your touch, kissing the inside of your palm sweetly, “I’m not the one that did, darling.”

“You’re saying I did?” you laugh. “By slapping you?”

“I’m not ashamed to admit I was hooked from the beginning, my pet,” he smiles, dipping down to place tender kisses against the soft skin of your neck, making you gasp at the sensation of his cold lips on your body. “I’m enchanted by you, in all ways possible.”

“It seems the spell I cast on you has worked, it was my plan all along,” you tease him with a small laugh, inhaling sharply once more when he begins to nip and suck and bite on the hollow of your collarbone. That would surely leave a mark in the coming days. You know that’s what he wants, to mark you as his, his territory. The thought excited you. Being his. You can’t believe how good he is at this, so easily making you beg for more and grovel at his feet. 

“I really hope your joking, darling,” he teases back. “But I wouldn’t be at all surprised if you weren’t.”

You breathe out a laugh. “I guess you’ll never know then,” you raise an eyebrow when he breaks away to look at you. His striking eyes wash over you, paired with another gorgeous smirk. Those eyes fall on your lips, and he darts his tongue out to wet his own.

“Are you going to kiss me, Loki?” you ask softly, taking his face in your hands again, drawing small circles with your thumb on his cheek. 

“I want to, believe me. Desperately,” he says, breath catching when you meet his eyes, he fumbles for the right words. “But… are you sure?” he breaks his gaze away from your slightly parted lips, willing himself to look elsewhere. “Because-”

“Loki…” you coo softly, playing with the tips of his marvelous, raven hair, looking him in the eye, both of you breathing harshly, so close your noses bump into each other and lips brush, heart beating loud in your own chest. Not even kissing, yet electricity shoots through both of you, your eyes fluttering closed from the pleasure. “I’ve never been more sure of anything in my life. Because I-”

“Oh, my…” a smug, familiar voice says in the doorway, catching both of your attentions, heads snapping in their direction. 

Tony. Fucking. Stark. And the rest of the Avengers. All in your home and all at once. Watching and ruining a moment between you and Loki. 

“Reindeer games, and our sweet, sweet (y/n),” Tony says, looking to Natasha who’s smirking like an idiot. Steve’s eyes widen he sees the discarded bra on the floor, which makes you blush every shade of scarlet. Tony shakes his head like a disappointed father would when scolding his child. “I never thought I’d see the day…”

They’re all looking at the two of you, neither of you moving, too frozen from shock at the sight of them all. Bucky looks between the two of you and shakes his head, “I think this is the part when one of you starts explaining what the hell is going on.”

Tony. Fucking. Stark. And the rest of the Avengers. All in your home and all at once. Watching and ruining a moment between you and Loki. 

“Reindeer games, and our sweet, sweet (y/n),” Tony says, looking to Natasha who’s smirking like an idiot. Steve’s eyes widen he sees the discarded bra on the floor, which makes you blush every shade of scarlet. Tony shakes his head like a disappointed father would when scolding his child. “I never thought I’d see the day…”

They’re all looking at the two of you, neither of you moving, too frozen from shock at the sight of them all. Bucky looks between the two of you and shakes his head, “I think this is the part when one of you starts explaining what the hell is going on.”

summary: Did you notice how it sucks to adopt a child in the MCU ? Like Tony adopted Peter, Peter died. Yondu adopted Starlord, Yondu...
body:
Did you notice how it sucks to adopt a child in the MCU ?

Like Tony adopted Peter, Peter died. Yondu adopted Starlord, Yondu died and Starlord too. Thanos adopted Gamora, he sacrificed her. Rocket adopted Groot,  Groot died 2 times.
